page.title: 11ST.MARGARETS- FARMING
page.content: {SQUARE 3711 The{LANDSCAPE}of the area is flat except for a small portion which slopes down to the New River canal. Woodland is sparse and there are scattered trees along the roads & near habitations.{FARMING}occupies much of the square. A single private field, planted with barley, is leased. Hillside Nurseries, a small market- gardening enterprise is situated near this field and consists of nine glasshouses in which tomatoes, cucumbers and lettuces are grown. One part-time & two full-time workers are employed to supply Covent Garden and Spitalfields markets. Bordering on these nurseries, there is enclosed rough grazing supporting a herd of Friesian cows.
